R0068.title: After-Sales Rights Abuse
R0068.definition: Malicious exploitation and excessive use of rights granted by the platform.
R0068.description: For example, national regulations require online shopping platforms to offer 7-day no-questions-asked returns. Buyers exploit this mechanism to use products or services for free and then initiate a return within 7 days.
R0068.influence: Causes financial losses to the platform or sellers.

references.title: Consumer Rights: Abuse Is Also a Form of Harm

R0068-001.title: Malicious Complaints
R0068-001.definition: Filing malicious complaints against a trading platform or against merchants on a trading platform.
R0068-001.description: With the goal of gaining improper benefits or forcing the target to be penalized, attackers file malicious complaints against a trading platform through regulatory bodies, or against merchants through the trading platform.
R0068-001.influence: Causes financial or reputational losses to the platform or sellers.

references.title: How E-Commerce Platform Merchants Can Respond to Malicious Complaints

R0068-002.title: Malicious Claims
R0068-002.definition: Bulk-purchasing expired, unlisted, or counterfeit goods and filing tenfold compensation claims.
R0068-002.description: Using bulk searches, data scraping, and similar methods to find expired, counterfeit, substandard, or non-compliant products (e.g., containing advertising law prohibited terms). After placing orders, the buyer complains about the seller's violations and demands large sums of money in exchange for withdrawing the complaint.
R0068-002.influence: Causes financial losses to the platform or sellers.

references.title: Malicious Claims Gray Industry Chain! Praise or Punish?
